content.title: d550 Eating
content.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks and actions of eating food that has been served, bringing it to the mouth and consuming it in culturally acceptable ways, cutting or breaking food into pieces, opening bottles and cans, using eating implements, having meals, feasting or dining.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: drinking (d560)

content.title: d560 Drinking
content.description: Taking hold of a drink, bringing it to the mouth, and consuming the drink in culturally acceptable ways, mixing, stirring and pouring liquids for drinking, opening bottles and cans, drinking through a straw or drinking running water such as from a tap or a spring; feeding from the breast.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: eating (d550)

d940 Human rights
content.description: Enjoying all nationally and internationally recognized rights that are accorded to people by virtue of their humanity alone, such as human rights as recognized by the United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights (1948), the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (1989), the United Nations Standard Rules for the Equalisation of Opportunities for Persons with Disabilities (1993), and the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (2006); the right to self-determination or autonomy; and the right to control over one's destiny.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: Political life and citizenship (d950)

content.title: d950 Political life and citizenship
content.description: Engaging in the social, political, governmental life of a citizen, having legal status as a citizen and enjoying the rights, protections, privileges and duties associated with that role, such as the right to vote and run for political office, to form political associations, enjoying the rights and freedoms associated with citizenship (e.g. the rights of freedom of speech, association, religion, protections against unreasonable search and seizure, the right to counsel, to a trial and other legal rights and protections against discrimination); having legal standing as a citizen.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: human rights (d940)

content.title: e230 Natural events
content.description: Geographic and atmospheric changes that cause disruption in an individual's physical environment, occurring regularly or irregularly, such as earthquakes and severe or violent weather conditions, e.g. tornadoes, hurricanes, typhoons, floods, forest fires and ice-storms.

name: Human-caused events
path: Natural environment and human-made changes to environment

content.title: e235 Human-caused events
content.description: Alterations or disturbances in the natural environment, caused by humans, that may result in the disruption of people's day-to-day lives, including events or conditions linked to conflict and wars, such as the displacement of people, destruction of social infrastructure, homes and lands, environmental disasters and land, water or air pollution (e.g. toxic spills).

content.title: e255 Vibration
content.description: Regular or irregular to and fro motion of an object or an individual caused by a physical disturbance, such as shaking, quivering, quick jerky movements of things, buildings or people caused by small or large equipment, aircraft, and explosion.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: natural events (e230), such as vibration or shaking of the earth caused by earthquakes

e310 Immediate family
content.description: Individuals related by birth, marriage or other relationship recognized by the culture as immediate family, such as spouses, partners, parents, siblings, children, foster parents, adoptive parents and grandparents.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: extended family (e315); personal care providers and personal assistants (e340)

content.title: e315 Extended family
content.description: Individuals related through family or marriage or other relationships recognized by the culture as extended family, such as aunts, uncles, nephews and nieces.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: immediate family (e310)

content.title: e320 Friends
content.description: Individuals who are close and ongoing participants in relationships characterized by trust and mutual support.

name: Acquaintances, peers, colleagues, neighbours and community members
path: Acquaintances, peers, colleagues, neighbours and community members

content.title: e325 Acquaintances, peers, colleagues, neighbours and community members
content.description: Individuals who are familiar to each other as acquaintances, peers, colleagues, neighbours, and community members, in situations of work, school, recreation, or other aspects of life, and who share demographic features such as age, gender, religious creed or ethnicity or pursue common interests.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: associations and organizational services (e5550)

content.title: e330 People in positions of authority
content.description: Individuals who have decision-making responsibilities for others and who have socially defined influence or power based on their social, economic, cultural or religious roles in society, such as teachers, employers, supervisors, religious leaders, substitute decision-makers, guardians or trustees.

content.title: e335 People in subordinate positions
content.description: Individuals whose day-to-day life is influenced by people in positions of authority in work, school or other settings, such as students, workers, and members of a religious group.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: immediate family (e310)

name: Personal care providers and personal assistants
path: Personal care providers and personal assistants

content.title: e340 Personal care providers and personal assistants
content.description: Individuals who provide services to support individuals in their daily activities and maintenance of performance at work, education or other life situation, provided either through public or private funds, or else on a voluntary basis, such as providers of support for home-making and maintenance, personal assistants, transport assistant, paid help, nannies and others who function as primary caregivers.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: immediate family (e310); extended family (e315); friends (e320); general social support services (e5750); health professionals (e355)

content.title: e345 Strangers
content.description: Individuals who are unfamiliar and unrelated, or those who have not yet established a relationship or association, including persons unknown to the individual but who are sharing a life situation with them, such as substitute teachers, co-workers or care providers.

content.title: e350 Domesticated animals
content.description: Animals that provide physical, emotional, or psychological support, such as pets (dogs, cats, birds, fish, etc.) and animals for personal mobility and transportation.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: animals (e2201); assets (e165)

content.title: e355 Health professionals
content.description: All service providers working within the context of the health system, such as doctors, nurses, physiotherapists, occupational therapists, speech therapists, audiologists, orthotist-prosthetists, medical social workers.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: other professionals (e360)

content.title: e360 Other professionals
content.description: All service providers working outside of the health system, including social workers, lawyers, teachers, architects and designers.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: health professionals (e355)

content.title: e398 Support and relationships, other specified

content.description: General or specific opinions and beliefs of immediate family members about the person or about other matters (e.g. social, political and economic issues), that influence individual behaviour and actions.

content.title: e435 Individual attitudes of people in subordinate positions
content.description: General or specific opinions and beliefs of people in subordinate positions about the person or about other matters, (e.g. social, political and economic issues), that influence individual behaviour and actions.

path: Individual attitudes of personal care providers and personal assistants

content.title: e440 Individual attitudes of personal care providers and personal assistants
content.description: General or specific opinions and beliefs of personal care providers and personal assistants about the person or about other matters, (e.g. social, political and economic issues), that influence individual behaviour and actions.

content.title: e445 Individual attitudes of strangers
content.description: General or specific opinions and beliefs of strangers about the person or about other matters, (e.g. social, political and economic issues), that influence individual behaviour and actions.

content.title: e450 Individual attitudes of health professionals
content.description: General or specific opinions and beliefs of health professionals about the person or about other matters, (e.g. social, political and economic issues), that influence individual behaviour and actions.

content.title: e455 Individual attitudes of other professionals
content.description: General or specific opinions and beliefs of health-related professionals about the person or about other matters, (e.g. social, political and economic issues), that influence individual behaviour and actions.

content.title: e460 Societal attitudes
content.description: General or specific opinions and beliefs generally held by people of a culture, society, sub-cultural or other social group about other individuals or about other social, political and economic issues, that influence group or individual behaviour and actions.

content.title: e465 Social norms, practices and ideologies
content.description: Customs, practices, rules and abstract systems of values and normative beliefs (e.g.ideologies, normative world views and moral philosophies) that arise within social contexts and that affect or create societal and individual practices and behaviours, such as social norms of moral and religious behaviour or etiquette; religious doctrine and resulting norms and practices; norms governing rituals or social gatherings.

d110 Watching
content.description: Using the sense of seeing intentionally to experience visual stimuli, such as visually tracking an object, watching a sporting event, people, or children playing.

content.title: d115 Listening
content.description: Using the sense of hearing intentionally to experience auditory stimuli, such as listening to a radio, to the human voice, to music, to a lecture or to a story told.

name: Purposeful sensory experiences, other specified and unspecified
path: Purposeful sensory experiences, other specified and unspecified

content.title: d129 Purposeful sensory experiences, other specified and unspecified
d130 Copying
content.description: Imitating or mimicking as a basic component of learning, such as copying a facial expression, a gesture, a sound, or the letters of an alphabet.

content.title: d133 Acquiring an additional language
content.description: Developing the competence to represent persons, objects, events, feelings through words, symbols, phrases and sentences, in an additional language such as a foreign language or signing.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: acquiring language (d132); communication (d310-d399)

content.title: d135 Rehearsing
content.description: Repeating a sequence of events or symbols as a basic component of learning, such as counting by tens or practising the recitation of a rhyme with gestures or chords on a musical instrument.

content.title: d138 Acquiring information
content.description: Obtaining facts about persons, things and events, such as asking why, what, where and how, asking for names.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: acquiring concepts (d137); acquiring skills (d155)

name: Basic learning, other specified and unspecified
path: Basic learning, other specified and unspecified

content.title: d159 Basic learning, other specified and unspecified
d163 Thinking
content.description: Formulating and manipulating ideas, concepts, and images, whether goal-oriented or not, either alone or with others, such as creating fiction, proving a theorem, playing with ideas, brainstorming, meditating, pondering, speculating, or reflecting.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: solving problems (d175); making decisions (d177)

content.title: d166 Reading
content.description: Performing activities involved in the comprehension and interpretation of written language (e.g. books, instructions or newspapers in text or Braille), for the purpose of obtaining general knowledge or specific information.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: learning to read (d140)

content.title: d177 Making decisions
content.description: Making a choice among options, implementing the choice, and evaluating the effects of the choice, such as selecting and purchasing a specific item, or deciding to undertake and undertaking one task from among several tasks that need to be done.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: thinking (d163); solving problems (d175)

name: Applying knowledge, other specified and unspecified
path: Applying knowledge, other specified and unspecified

content.title: d179 Applying knowledge, other specified and unspecified
d2100 Undertaking a simple task
content.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space required for a simple task; executing a simple task with a single major component, such as reading a book, writing a letter, or making one's bed.

content.title: d2101 Undertaking a complex task
content.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for a single complex task; executing a complex task with more than one component, which may be carried out in sequence or simultaneously, such as arranging the furniture in one's home or completing an assignment for school.

content.title: d2102 Undertaking a single task independently
content.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for a simple or complex task; managing and executing a task on one's own and without the assistance of others.

name: Undertaking a single task in a group
path: Undertaking a single task in a group

content.title: d2103 Undertaking a single task in a group
content.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for a single task, simple or complex; managing and executing a task with people who are involved in some or all steps of the task.

content.title: d2108 Undertaking single tasks, other specified
d2200 Carrying out multiple tasks
content.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space needed for several tasks, and managing and executing several tasks, together or sequentially.

content.title: d2201 Completing multiple tasks
content.description: Completing several tasks, together or sequentially.

content.title: d2202 Undertaking multiple tasks independently
content.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for multiple tasks, and managing and executing several tasks together or sequentially, on one's own and without the assistance of others.

name: Undertaking multiple tasks in a group
path: Undertaking multiple tasks in a group

content.title: d2203 Undertaking multiple tasks in a group
content.description: Preparing, initiating and arranging the time and space for multiple tasks, and managing and executing several tasks together or sequentially with others who are involved in some or all steps of the multiple tasks.

content.title: d2208 Undertaking multiple tasks, other specified
d2301 Managing daily routine
content.description: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions in order to plan and manage the requirements of day-to-day procedures or duties.

content.title: d2302 Completing the daily routine
content.description: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions in order to complete the requirements of usual day-to-day procedures or duties, such as getting dressed, eating breakfast, leaving for school or work and returning home at the end of the day.

content.title: d2303 Managing one's own activity level
content.description: Carrying out actions and behaviours to arrange the requirements in energy and time day-to-day procedures or duties.

name: Adapting to changes in daily routine
path: Adapting to changes in daily routine

content.title: d2304 Adapting to changes in daily routine
content.description: Interrupting and shifting tasks and actions in response to new requirements or making a transition from a usual pattern of activities to a new set of activities as a means of fulfilling daily tasks.

content.description: Carrying out simple or complex and coordinated actions to cope with decisive turning points in a situation or times of acute danger or difficulty.

content.title: d5301 Regulating defecation
content.description: Coordinating and managing defecation such as by indicating need, getting into the proper position, choosing and getting to an appropriate place for defecation, manipulating clothing before and after defecation, and cleaning oneself after defecation.

content.title: d5302 Menstrual care
content.description: Coordinating, planning and caring for menstruation, such as by anticipating menstruation and using sanitary towels and napkins.

content.title: d5400 Putting on clothes
content.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks of putting clothes on various parts of the body, such as putting clothes on over the head, over the arms and shoulders, and on the lower and upper halves of the body; putting on gloves and headgear.

content.title: d5401 Taking off clothes
content.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks of taking clothes off various parts of the body, such as pulling clothes off and over the head, off the arms and shoulders, and off the lower and upper halves of the body; taking off gloves and headgear.

content.title: d5402 Putting on footwear
content.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks of putting on socks, stockings and footwear.

content.title: d5403 Taking off footwear
content.description: Carrying out the coordinated tasks of taking off socks, stockings and footwear.

content.title: d5404 Choosing appropriate clothing
content.description: Following implicit or explicit dress codes and conventions of one's society or culture and dressing in keeping with climatic conditions.

content.title: d5700 Ensuring one's physical comfort
content.description: Caring for oneself by being aware that one needs to ensure, and ensuring, that one's body is in a comfortable position, that one is not feeling too hot, cold or wet, and that one has adequate lighting.

content.title: d5701 Managing diet and fitness
content.description: Caring for oneself by being aware of the need and by selecting and consuming nutritious foods and maintaining physical fitness.

content.title: d5702 Maintaining one's health
content.description: Caring for oneself by being aware of the need and doing what is required to look after one's health, both to respond to risks to health and to prevent ill-health, such as by seeking assistance (professional and non professional); following medical and other health advice; and managing risks to health such as injuries, communicable diseases, drug-taking and sexual transmitted diseases.

d810 Informal education
content.description: Learning at home or in some other non-institutional setting, such as learning crafts and other skills from parents or family members, or home schooling.

content.title: d815 Preschool education
content.description: Learning at an initial level of organized instruction, designed primarily to introduce a child to the school-type environment and prepare it for compulsory education, such as by acquiring skills in a day-care or similar setting as preparation for advancement to school.

content.title: d820 School education
content.description: Gaining admission to school, education, engaging in all school-related responsibilities and privileges, and learning the course material, subjects and other curriculum requirements in a primary or secondary education programme, including attending school regularly, working cooperatively with other students, taking directions from teachers, organizing, studying and completing assigned tasks and projects, and advancing to other stages of education.

content.title: d825 Vocational training
content.description: Engaging in all activities of a vocational programme and learning the curriculum material for preparation for employment in a trade, job or profession.

content.title: d830 Higher education
content.description: Engaging in the activities of advanced educational programmes in universities, colleges and professional schools and learning all aspects of the curriculum required for degrees, diplomas, certificates and other accreditations, such as completing a university bachelor's or master's course of study, medical school or other professional school.

content.title: d835 Education life
content.description: Engaging in aspects of life of education institutions, such as university and school related associations, including: clubs, sports, related civic bodies (e.g. school council), and other institutionally-organized initiatives that are not part of the academic curriculum.

content.title: d840 Apprenticeship (work preparation)
content.description: Engaging in programmes related to preparation for employment, such as performing the tasks required of an apprenticeship, internship, articling and in-service training.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: vocational training (d825)

e5950 Political services
content.description: Services and structures such as local, regional and national governments, international organizations and the people who are elected or nominated to positions within these structures, such as the United Nations, European Union, governments, regional authorities, local village authorities, traditional leaders.

content.title: e5951 Political systems
content.description: Structures and related operations that organise political and economic power in a society, such as executive and legislative branches of government, and the constitutional or other legal sources from which they derive their authority, such as political organizational doctrine, constitutions, agencies of executive and legislative branches of government, the military.

content.title: e5952 Political policy
content.description: Laws and policies formulated and enforced through political systems that govern the operation of the political system, such as policies governing election campaigns, registration of political parties, voting, and members in international political organizations, including treaties, constitutional and other law governing legislation and regulation.

b1100 State of consciousness
content.description: Mental functions that when altered produce states such as clouding of consciousness, stupor or coma.

content.title: b1101 Continuity of consciousness
content.description: Mental functions that produce sustained wakefulness, alertness and awareness and, when disrupted, may produce fugue, trance or other similar states.

content.title: b1102 Quality of consciousness
content.description: Mental functions that when altered effect changes in the character of wakeful, alert and aware sentience, such as druginduced altered states or delirium.

content.title: b1140 Orientation to time
content.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of time of the day, day of the week, date, month and year.

content.title: b1141 Orientation to place
content.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of one's location, such as one's immediate surroundings, one's town or country.

content.title: b1143 Orientation to objects
content.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of objects or features of objects.

content.title: b1144 Orientation to space
content.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of oneâ€™s body in relation to the immediate physical space.

content.title: b1260 Extraversion
content.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is outgoing, sociable and demonstrative, as contrasted to being shy, restricted and inhibited.

content.title: b1261 Agreeableness
content.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is cooperative, amicable, and accomodating, as contrasted to being unfriendly, oppositional and defiant.

content.title: b1262 Conscientiousness
content.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition such as in being hard-working, methodical and scrupulous, as contrasted to mental functions producing dispositions such as being lazy, unreliable and irresponsible.

content.title: b1263 Psychic stability
content.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is even-tempered, calm and composed, as contrasted to being irritable, worried, erratic and moody.

content.title: b1264 Openness to experience
content.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is curious, imaginative, inquisitive and experience-seeking, as contrasted to being stagnant, inattentive and emotionally inexpressive.

content.title: b1265 Optimism
content.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is cheerful, buoyant and hopeful, as contrasted to being downhearted, gloomy and despairing.

content.title: b1266 Confidence
content.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is self-assured, bold and assertive, as contrasted to being timid, insecure and self effacing.

content.title: b1267 Trustworthiness
content.description: Mental functions that produce a personal disposition that is dependable and principled, as contrasted to being deceitful and antisocial.

name: Temperament and personality functions, other specified
path: Temperament and personality functions, other specified

content.title: b1268 Temperament and personality functions, other specified
b1269 Temperament and personality functions, unspecified
b1300 Energy level
content.description: Mental functions that produce vigour and stamina.

content.title: b1301 Motivation
content.description: Mental functions that produce the incentive to act; the conscious or unconscious driving force for action.

content.title: b1302 Appetite
content.description: Mental functions that produce a natural longing or desire, especially the natural and recurring desire for food and drink.

content.title: b1303 Craving
content.description: Mental functions that produce the urge to consume substances, including substances that can be abused.

content.title: b1304 Impulse control
content.description: Mental functions that regulate and resist sudden intense urges to do something.

name: Energy and drive functions, other specified
path: Energy and drive functions, other specified

content.title: b1308 Energy and drive functions, other specified
b1309 Energy and drive functions, unspecified
b1340 Amount of sleep
content.description: Mental functions involved in the time spent in the state of sleep in the diurnal cycle or circadian rhythm.

content.title: b1341 Onset of sleep
content.description: Mental functions that produce the transition between wakefulness and sleep.

content.title: b1342 Maintenance of sleep
content.description: Mental functions that sustain the state of being asleep.

content.title: b1343 Quality of sleep
content.description: Mental functions that produce the natural sleep leading to optimal physical and mental rest and relaxation.

content.title: b1344 Functions involving the sleep cycle
content.description: Mental functions that produce rapid eye movement (REM) sleep (associated with dreaming) and non-rapid eye movement sleep (NREM) (characterized by the traditional concept of sleep as a time of decreased physiological and psychological activity).

content.title: b1400 Sustaining attention
content.description: Mental functions that produce concentration for the period of time required.

content.title: b1401 Shifting attention
content.description: Mental functions that permit refocusing concentration from one stimulus to another.

content.title: b1402 Dividing attention
content.description: Mental functions that permit focusing on two or more stimuli at the same time.

content.title: b1403 Sharing attention
content.description: Mental functions that permit focusing on the same stimulus by two or more people, such as a child and a caregiver both focusing on a toy.

content.title: b1440 Short-term memory
content.description: Mental functions that produce a temporary, disruptable memory store of around 30 seconds duration from which information is lost if not consolidated into long-term memory.

content.title: b1441 Long-term memory
content.description: Mental functions that produce a memory system permitting the long-term storage of information from short-term memory and both autobiographical memory for past events and semantic memory for language and facts.

content.title: b1442 Retrieval and processing of memory
content.description: Specific mental functions of recalling information stored in long-term memory and bringing it into awareness.

content.title: b1443 Working memory
content.description: Mental functions that compare and process information retrieved from both short-term and long-term memory.

content.title: b1470 Psychomotor control
content.description: Mental functions that regulate the speed of behaviour or response time that involves both motor and psychological components, such as in disruption of control producing psychomotor retardation (moving and speaking slowly; decrease in gesturing and spontaneity) or psychomotor excitement (excessive behavioural and cognitive activity, usually nonproductive and often in response to inner tension as in toe-tapping, hand-wringing, agitation, or restlessness).

content.title: b1471 Quality of psychomotor functions
content.description: Mental functions that produce nonverbal behaviour in the proper sequence and character of its subcomponents, such as hand and eye coordination, or gait.

content.title: b1520 Appropriateness of emotion
content.description: Mental functions that produce congruence of feeling or affect with the situation, such as happiness at receiving good news.

content.title: b1521 Regulation of emotion
content.description: Mental functions that control the experience and display of affect.

content.title: b1522 Range of emotion
content.description: Mental functions that produce the spectrum of experience of arousal of affect or feelings such as love, hate, anxiousness, sorrow, joy, fear and anger.

content.title: b1560 Auditory perception
content.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating sounds, tones, pitches and other acoustic stimuli.

content.title: b1561 Visual perception
content.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating shape, size, colour and other ocular stimuli.

content.title: b1562 Olfactory perception
content.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in smells.

content.title: b1563 Gustatory perception
content.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in tastes, such as sweet, sour, salty and bitter stimuli, detected by the tongue.

content.title: b1564 Tactile perception
content.description: Mental functions involved in distinguishing differences in texture, such as rough or smooth stimuli, detected by touch.

content.title: b1565 Visuospatial perception
content.description: Mental function involved in distinguishing by sight the relative position of objects in the environment or in relation to oneself.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: orientation to objects (b1143)

content.title: b1600 Pace of thought
content.description: Mental functions that govern speed of the thinking process.

content.title: b1601 Form of thought
content.description: Mental functions that organize the thinking process as to its coherence and logic.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: impairments of ideational perseveration, tangentiality and circumstantiality

content.title: b1602 Content of thought
content.description: Mental functions consisting of the ideas that are present in the thinking process and what is being conceptualized.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: impairments of delusions, overvalued ideas and somatization

content.title: b1603 Control of thought
content.description: Mental functions that provide volitional control of thinking and are recognized as such by the person.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: impairments of rumination, obsession, thought broadcast and thought insertion

content.title: b1640 Abstraction
content.description: Mental functions of creating general ideas, qualities or characteristics out of, and distinct from, concrete realities, specific objects or actual instances.

content.title: b1641 Organization and planning
content.description: Mental functions of coordinating parts into a whole, of systematizing; the mental function involved in developing a method of proceeding or acting.

content.title: b1642 Time management
content.description: Mental functions of ordering events in chronological sequence, allocating amounts of time to events and activities.

content.title: b1643 Cognitive flexibility
content.description: Mental functions of changing strategies, or shifting mental sets, especially as involved in problem-solving.

content.title: b1644 Insight
content.description: Mental functions of awareness and understanding of oneself and one's behaviour.

content.title: b1645 Judgement
content.description: Mental functions involved in discriminating between and evaluating different options, such as those involved in forming an opinion.

content.title: b1646 Problem Solving
content.description: Mental functions of identifying, analysing, and integrating incongruent or conflicting information into a solution.

content.title: b1648 Higher-level cognitive functions, other specified
b1672 Integrative language functions
content.description: Mental functions that organize semantic and symbolic meaning, grammatical structure and ideas for the production of messages in spoken, written or other forms of language.

d3300 Producing meaningful sounds
content.description: Using single words to label objects, persons or actions such as ball, mommy, bye-bye.

content.title: d3301 Producing simple spoken messages
content.description: Using words to produce simple spoken messages such as single or few words or expressing a need (e.g. I want ...) or feeling (e.g., I like ...).

content.title: d3302 Producing complex spoken messages
content.description: Using words to produce complex spoken messages (complete sentences) such as giving an explanation or asking for directions.

content.title: d3350 Producing body language
content.description: Conveying messages by intentional movements of the body, such as facial gestures (e.g. smiling, frowning, wincing), by arm and hand movements, and by postures (e.g. embracing to indicate affection or pointing to receive attention or an object).

content.title: d3351 Producing signs and symbols
content.description: Conveying meaning by using signs and symbols (e.g. icons, Bliss board, scientific symbols) and symbolic notation systems, such as using musical notation to convey a melody.

content.title: d3352 Producing drawings and photographs
content.description: Conveying meaning by drawing, painting, sketching, and making diagrams, pictures or photographs, such as drawing a map to give someone directions to a location.

d4100 Lying down
content.description: Getting into and out of a lying down position or changing body position, from horizontal to any other position, such as standing up or sitting down.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: getting into a prostrate position

content.title: d4101 Squatting
content.description: Getting into and out of the seated or crouched posture on one's haunches with knees closely drawn up or sitting on one's heels, such as may be necessary in toilets that are at floor level, or changing body position from squatting to any other position, such as standing up.

content.title: d4102 Kneeling
content.description: Getting into and out of a position where the body is supported by the knees with legs bent, such as during prayers, or changing body position from kneeling to any other position, such as standing up.

content.title: d4103 Sitting
content.description: Getting into and out of a seated position and changing body position from sitting down to any other position, such as standing up or lying down.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: getting into a sitting position with bent legs or cross-legged; getting into a sitting position with feet supported or unsupported

content.title: d4104 Standing
content.description: Getting into and out of a standing position or changing body position from standing to any other position, such as lying down or sitting down.

content.title: d4105 Bending
content.description: Tilting the back downwards or to the side, at the torso, such as in bowing or reaching down for an object.

name: Shifting the body's centre of gravity
path: Shifting the body's centre of gravity

content.title: d4106 Shifting the body's centre of gravity
content.description: Adjusting or moving the weight of the body from one position to another while sitting, standing or lying, such as moving from one foot to another while standing.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: transferring oneself (d420); walking (d450)

content.title: d4107 Rolling Over
content.description: moving the body from one position to another while lying such as turning from side to side or from stomach to back.

name: Changing basic body position, other specified
path: Changing basic body position, other specified

content.title: d4108 Changing basic body position, other specified
d4109 Changing basic body position, unspecified
d4150 Maintaining a lying position
content.description: Staying in a lying position for some time as required, such as remaining in a prone position in a bed.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: staying in a prone (face down or prostrate), supine (face upwards) or side-lying position

content.title: d4151 Maintaining a squatting position
content.description: Staying in a squatting position such as when sitting on the floor without a seat.

content.title: d4152 Maintaining a kneeling position
content.description: Staying in a kneeling position where the body is supported by the knees with legs bent for some time such as during prayers in church.

content.title: d4153 Maintaining a sitting position
content.description: Staying in a seated position, on a seat or the floor, for some time such as when sitting at a desk or table.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: staying in a sitting position with straight legs or cross-legged, with feet supported or unsupported

content.title: d4154 Maintaining a standing position
content.description: Staying in a standing position for some time as required, such as when standing in a queue.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: staying in a standing position on a slope, on slippery or hard surfaces

content.title: d4155 Maintaining head position
content.description: controlling the position of the head and supporting its weight for a determined period of time.

name: Maintaining a body position, other specified
path: Maintaining a body position, other specified

content.title: d4158 Maintaining a body position, other specified
d4159 Maintaining a body position, unspecified
d4200 Transferring oneself while sitting
content.description: Moving from a sitting position on one seat to another seat on the same or a different level, such as moving from a chair to a bed.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: moving from a chair to another seat, such as a toilet seat; moving from a wheelchair to a car seat
content.exclusions: Exclusions: changing basic body position (d410)

content.title: d4201 Transferring oneself while lying
content.description: Moving from one lying position to another on the same or a different level, such as moving from one bed to another.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: changing basic body position (d410)

content.title: d4300 Lifting
content.description: Raising up an object in order to move it from a lower to a higher level, such as when lifting a glass from the table.

content.title: d4301 Carrying in the hands
content.description: Taking or transporting an object from one place to another using the hands, such as when carrying a drinking glass or a suitcase.

content.title: d4302 Carrying in the arms
content.description: Taking or transporting an object from one place to another using the arms and hands, such as when carrying a pet or a child or other large object.

name: Carrying on shoulders, hip and back
path: Carrying on shoulders, hip and back

content.title: d4303 Carrying on shoulders, hip and back
content.description: Taking or transporting an object from one place to another using the shoulders, hip or back, or some combination of these, such as when carrying a large parcel or school bag.

content.title: d4304 Carrying on the head
content.description: Taking or transporting an object from one place to another using the head, such when as carrying a container of water on the head.

content.title: d4305 Putting down objects
content.description: Using hands, arms or other parts of the body to place an object down on a surface or place, such as when lowering a container of water to the ground.

content.title: d4308 Lifting and carrying, other specified
d4350 Pushing with lower extremities
content.description: Using the legs and feet to exert a force on an object to move it away, such as pushing a chair away with a foot.

content.title: d4351 Kicking
content.description: Using the legs and feet to propel something away, such as kicking a ball.

name: Moving objects with lower extremities, other specified
path: Moving objects with lower extremities, other specified

content.title: d4358 Moving objects with lower extremities, other specified

name: Moving objects with lower extremities, unspecified
path: Moving objects with lower extremities, unspecified

content.title: d4359 Moving objects with lower extremities, unspecified
d4400 Picking up
content.description: Lifting or taking up a small object with hands and fingers, such as when picking up a pencil.

content.title: d4401 Grasping
content.description: Using one or both hands to seize and hold something, such as when grasping a tool or a door knob.

content.title: d4402 Manipulating
content.description: Using fingers and hands to exert control over, direct or guide something, such as when handling coins or other small objects, such as scissors, shoe laces, pencils, chopsticks, knives and forks.

content.title: d4403 Releasing
content.description: Using fingers and hands to let go or set free something so that it falls or changes position, such as when dropping an item of clothing or a piece of food for a pet.

content.title: d4408 Fine hand use, other specified
d4450 Pulling
content.description: Using fingers, hands and arms to bring an object towards oneself, or to move it from place to place, such as when pulling on a string or pulling a door closed.

content.title: d4451 Pushing
content.description: Using fingers, hands and arms to move something from oneself, or to move it from place to place, such as when pushing a toy or an animal away.

content.title: d4452 Reaching
content.description: Using the hands and arms to extend outwards and touch and grasp something, such as when reaching across a table or desk for a book.

name: Turning or twisting the hands or arms
path: Turning or twisting the hands or arms

content.title: d4453 Turning or twisting the hands or arms
content.description: Using fingers, hands or arms to rotate, turn or bend an object as is required to open a jar or use tools such as a toothbrush or screwdriver.

content.title: d4454 Throwing
content.description: Using fingers, hands and arms to lift something and propel it with some force through the air, such as when tossing a ball.

content.title: d4455 Catching
content.description: Using fingers, hands and arms to grasp a moving object in order to bring it to a stop and hold it, such as when catching a ball.

name: Hand and arm use, other specified
path: Hand and arm use, other specified

content.title: d4458 Hand and arm use, other specified
d4459 Hand and arm use, unspecified
d4500 Walking short distances
content.description: Walking for less than a kilometre, such as walking around rooms or hallways, within a building or for short distances outside.

content.title: d4501 Walking long distances
content.description: Walking for more than a kilometre, such as across a village or town, between villages or across open areas.

content.title: d4502 Walking on different surfaces
content.description: Walking on sloping, uneven, or moving surfaces, such as on grass, gravel or ice and snow, or walking aboard a ship, train or other vehicle.

content.title: d4503 Walking around obstacles
content.description: Walking in ways required to avoid moving and immobile objects, people, animals, and vehicles, such as walking around a marketplace or shop, around or through traffic or other crowded areas.

content.title: d4550 Crawling
content.description: Moving the whole body in a prone position from one place to another on hands, or hands and arms, and knees.

content.title: d4551 Climbing
content.description: Moving the whole body upwards or downwards, over surfaces or objects, such as climbing steps, rocks, ladders or stairs, curbs or other objects.

content.title: d4552 Running
content.description: Moving with quick steps so that both feet may be simultaneously off the ground.

content.title: d4553 Jumping
content.description: Moving up off the ground by bending and extending the legs, such as jumping on one foot, hopping, skipping and jumping or diving into water.

content.title: d4554 Swimming
content.description: Propelling the whole body through water by means of limb and body movements without taking support from the ground underneath.

content.title: d4600 Moving around within the home
content.description: Walking and moving around in one's home, within a room, between rooms, and around the whole residence or living area.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: moving from floor to floor, on an attached balcony, moving in a restricted area such as a courtyard, porch or garden

name: Moving around within buildings other than home
path: Moving around within buildings other than home

content.title: d4601 Moving around within buildings other than home
content.description: Walking and moving around within buildings other than one's residence, such as other people's homes, other private buildings, community and public buildings and enclosed areas.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: moving throughout all parts of buildings and enclosed areas, between floors, inside, outside and around buildings, both public and private

name: Moving around outside the home and other buildings
path: Moving around outside the home and other buildings

content.title: d4602 Moving around outside the home and other buildings
content.description: Walking and moving around close to or far from one's home and other buildings, without the use of transportation, public or private, such as walking for short or long distances around a town or village.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: walking or moving down streets in the neighbourhood, town, village or city; moving between cities, without using transportation

name: Moving around in different locations, other specified
path: Moving around in different locations, other specified

content.title: d4608 Moving around in different locations, other specified

path: Moving around in different locations, unspecified

d4700 Using human-powered vehicles
content.description: Being transported as a passenger by a mode of transportation powered by one or more people, such as riding in a pram or stroller, wheelchair propelled by another, rickshaw or rowboat.

content.title: d4701 Using private motorized transportation
content.description: Being transported as a passenger by private motorized vehicle over land, sea or air, such as by car, taxi or privately owned aircraft or boat.

content.title: d4702 Using public motorized transportation
content.description: Being transported as a passenger by a motorized vehicle over land, sea or air designed for public transportation, such as being a passenger on a bus, train, subway or aircraft.

content.title: d4703 Using humans for transportation
content.description: Being transported by another person, such as being carried in the arms, in a sheet or in a backpack.

content.title: d4750 Driving human-powered transportation
content.description: Driving a human-powered vehicle, such as a bicycle, tricycle, or rowboat.

content.title: d4751 Driving motorized vehicles
content.description: Driving a vehicle with a motor, such as an automobile, motorcycle, motorboat or aircraft.

content.title: d4752 Driving animal-powered vehicles
content.description: Driving a vehicle powered by an animal, such as a horse-drawn cart or carriage.

content.description: Acquiring the use of a house, apartment or other dwelling belonging to another in exchange for payment.

content.title: d6102 Furnishing a place to live
content.description: Equipping and arranging a living space with furniture, fixtures and other fittings and decorating rooms, arranging one's own space or room.

content.title: d6201 Gathering daily necessities
content.description: Obtaining, without exchange of money, goods and services required for daily living (including instructing and supervising an intermediate to gather daily necessities), such as by harvesting vegetable and fruits and getting water and fuel.

path: Acquisition of goods and services, other specified

d6300 Preparing simple meals
content.description: Planning, organizing, cooking and serving meals with small number of ingredients that require easy methods of preparation and serving, such as making a snack or small meal, and transforming food ingredients by cutting and stirring, boiling and heating food such as rice or potatoes.

content.title: d6301 Preparing complex meals
content.description: Planning, organizing, cooking and serving meals with large number of ingredients that require complex methods of preparation and serving, such as planning a meal with serveral dishes, and transforming food ingredients by combined actions of peeling, slicing, mixing, kneading, stirring, presenting and serving food in a manner appropriate to the occasion and culture.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: using household appliances (d6403)

name: Washing and drying clothes and garments
path: Washing and drying clothes and garments

content.title: d6400 Washing and drying clothes and garments
content.description: Washing clothes and garments by hand and hanging them out to dry in the air.

content.title: d6401 Cleaning cooking area and utensils
content.description: Cleaning up after cooking, such as by washing dishes, pans, pots and cooking utensils, and cleaning tables and floors around cooking and eating area.

content.title: d6402 Cleaning living area
content.description: Cleaning the living areas of the household, such as by tidying and dusting, sweeping, swabbing, mopping floors, cleaning windows and walls, cleaning bathrooms and toilets, cleaning household furnishings.

content.title: d6403 Using household appliances
content.description: Using all kinds of household appliances, such as washing machines, driers, irons, vacuum cleaners, dishwashers.

content.title: d6404 Storing daily necessities
content.description: Storing food, drinks, clothes and other household goods required for daily living; preparing food for conservation by canning, salting or refrigerating, keeping food fresh and out of the reach of animals.

content.title: d6405 Disposing of garbage
content.description: Disposing of household garbage such as by collecting trash and rubbish around the house, preparing garbage for disposal, using garbage disposal appliances; burning garbage.

name: Making and repairing clothes
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6500 Making and repairing clothes
content.description: Making and repairing clothes, such as by sewing, producing or mending clothes; reattaching buttons and fasteners; ironing clothes, fixing and polishing footwear.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: using household appliances (d6403)

name: Maintaining dwelling and furnishings
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6501 Maintaining dwelling and furnishings
content.description: Repairing and taking care of dwelling, its exterior, interior and contents, such as by painting, repairing fixtures and furniture, and using required tools for repair work.

name: Maintaining domestic appliances
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6502 Maintaining domestic appliances
content.description: Repairing and taking care of all domestic appliances for cooking, cleaning and repairing, such as by oiling and repairing tools and maintaining the washing machine.

name: Maintaining vehicles
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6503 Maintaining vehicles
content.description: Repairing and taking care of motorized and non-motorized vehicles for personal use, including bicycles, carts, automobiles and boats.

name: Maintaining assistive devices
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6504 Maintaining assistive devices
content.description: Repairing and taking care of assistive devices such as prostheses, orthoses and specialized tools and aids for housekeeping and personal care; maintaining and repairing aids for personal mobility such as canes, walkers, wheelchairs and scooters; and maintaining communication and recreational aids.

name: Taking care of plants, indoors and outdoors
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others
Taking care of plants, indoors and outdoors

content.title: d6505 Taking care of plants, indoors and outdoors
content.description: Taking care of plants inside and outside the house, such as by planting, watering and fertilizing plants; gardening and growing foods for personal use.

name: Taking care of animals
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6506 Taking care of animals
content.description: Taking care of domestic animals and pets, such as by feeding, cleaning, grooming and exercising pets; watching over the health of animals or pets; planning for the care of animals or pets in one's absence.

content.description: Assisting household members and others in performing self-care, including helping others with eating, bathing and dressing; taking care of children or members of the household who are sick or have difficulties with basic self-care; helping others with their toileting.

name: Assisting others in movement
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6601 Assisting others in movement
content.description: Assisting household members and others in movements and in moving outside the home, such as in the neighbourhood or city, to or from school, place of employment or other destination.

name: Assisting others in communication
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6602 Assisting others in communication
content.description: Assisting household members and others with their communication, such as by helping with speaking, writing or readings.

name: Assisting others in interpersonal relations

content.title: d6603 Assisting others in interpersonal relations
content.description: Assisting household members and others with their interpersonal interactions, such as by helping them to initiate, maintain or terminate relationships.

name: Assisting others in nutrition
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6604 Assisting others in nutrition
content.description: Assisting household members and others with their nutrition, such as by helping them to prepare and eat meals.

name: Assisting others in health maintenance
path: Caring for household objects and assisting others

content.title: d6605 Assisting others in health maintenance
content.description: Assisting household members and others with formal and informal health care, such as by ensuring that a child gets regular medical check-ups, or that an elderly relative takes required medication.

content.title: d7100 Respect and warmth in relationships
content.description: Showing and responding to consideration and esteem, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

content.title: d7101 Appreciation in relationships
content.description: Showing and responding to satisfaction and gratitude, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

content.title: d7102 Tolerance in relationships
content.description: Showing and responding to understanding and acceptance of behaviour, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

content.title: d7103 Criticism in relationships
content.description: Providing and responding to implicit and explicit differences of opinion or disagreement, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

content.title: d7104 Social cues in relationships
content.description: Giving and reacting appropriately to signs and hints that occur in social interactions.

content.title: d7105 Physical contact in relationships
content.description: Making and responding to bodily contact with others, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

content.title: d7106 Differentiation of familiar persons
content.description: Showing differential responses to individuals, such as by reaching out for the familiar person and differentiating them from strangers and reacting in an appropriate manner.

content.title: d7108 Basic interpersonal interactions, other specified
d7200 Forming relationships
content.description: Beginning and maintaining interactions with others for a short or long period of time, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner, such as by introducing oneself, finding and establishing friendships and professional relationships, starting a relationship that may become permanent, romantic or intimate.

content.title: d7201 Terminating relationships
content.description: Bringing interactions to a close in a contextually and socially appropriate manner, such as by ending temporary relationships at the end of a visit, ending long-term relationships with friends when moving to a new town or ending relationships with work colleagues, professional colleagues and service providers, and ending romantic or intimate relationships.

content.title: d7202 Regulating behaviours within interactions
content.description: Regulating emotions and impulses, verbal aggression and physical aggression in interactions with others, in a contextually and socially appropriate manner.

content.title: d7203 Interacting according to social rules
content.description: Acting independently in social interactions and complying with social conventions governing one's role, position or other social status in interactions with others.

content.title: d7204 Maintaining social space
content.description: Being aware of and maintaining a distance between oneself and others that is contextually, socially and culturally appropriate.

content.title: d7208 Complex interpersonal interactions, other specified
d7400 Relating with persons in authority
content.description: Creating and maintaining formal relations with people in positions of power of a higher rank or prestige relative to one's own position, such as an employer.

content.title: d7401 Relating with subordinates
content.description: Creating and maintaining formal relations with people in positions of lower rank or prestige relative to one's own social position, such as an employee or servant.

content.title: d7402 Relating with equals
content.description: Creating and maintaining formal relations with people in the same position of authority, rank or prestige relative to one's own social position.

content.title: d7500 Informal relationships with friends
content.description: Creating and maintaining friendship relationships that are characterized by mutual esteem an common interests.

content.title: d7501 Informal relationships with neighbours
content.description: Creating and maintaining informal relationships with people who live in nearby dwellings or living areas.

content.title: d7502 Informal relationships with acquaintances
content.description: Creating and maintaining informal relationships with people whom one knows but who are not close friends.

content.title: d7503 Informal relationships with co-inhabitants
content.description: Creating and maintaining informal relationships with people who are co-inhabitants of a house or other dwelling, privately or publicly run, for any purpose.

content.title: d7504 Informal relationships with peers
content.description: Creating and maintaining informal relationships with people who share the same age, interest or other common feature.

content.title: d7508 Informal social relationships, other specified
d7600 Parent-child relationships
content.description: Becomming and being a parent, both natural and adoptive, such as by having a child and relating to it as a parent or creating and maintaining a parental relationships with an adoptive child, and providing physical, intellectual and emotional nurture to one's natural or adoptive child.

content.title: d7601 Child-parent relationships
content.description: Creating and maintaining relationships with one's parent, such as a young child obeying his or her parents or an adult child taking care of his or her elderly parents.

content.title: d7602 Sibling relationships
content.description: Creating and maintaining a brotherly or sisterly relationship with a person who shares one or both parents by birth, adoption or marriage.

content.title: d7603 Extended family relationships
content.description: Creating and maintaining a family relationship with members of one's extended family, such as with cousins, aunts and uncles and grandparents.

content.title: d7700 Romantic relationships
content.description: Creating and maintaining a relationship based on emotional and physical attraction, potentially leading to long-term intimate relationships.

content.title: d7701 Spousal relationships
content.description: Creating and maintaining an intimate relationship of a legal nature with another person, such as in a legal marriage, including becoming and being a legally maried wife or husband or an unmarried spouse.

content.title: d7702 Sexual relationships
content.description: Creating and maintaining a relationship of a sexual nature, with a spouse or other partner.

path: Acquiring, keeping and terminating a job

content.title: d8450 Seeking employment
content.description: Locating and choosing a job, in a trade, profession or other form of employment, and performing the required tasks to get hired, such as showing up at the place of employment or participating in a job interview.

name: Maintaining a job

content.title: d8451 Maintaining a job
content.description: Performing job-related tasks to keep an occupation, trade, profession or other form of employment, and obtaining promotion and other advancements in employment.

path: Acquiring, keeping and terminating a job

content.title: d8452 Terminating a job
content.description: Leaving or quitting a job in the appropriate manner.

content.title: d8459 Acquiring, keeping and terminating a job, unspecified
d8500 Self employment
content.description: Engaging in remunerative work sought or generated by the individual, or contracted from others without a formal employment relationship, such as migratory agricultural work, working as a free-lance writer or consultant, short-term contract work, working as an artist or crafts person, owning and running a shop or other business.
content.exclusions: Exclusions: part-time and full-time employment (d8501, d8502)

content.title: d8501 Part-time employment
content.description: Engaging in all aspects of work for payment on a part-time basis, as an employee, such as seeking employment and getting a job, doing the tasks required of the job, attending work on time as required, supervising other workers or being supervised, and performing required tasks alone or in groups.

content.title: d8502 Full-time employment
content.description: Engaging in all aspects of work for payment on a full-time basis, as an employee, such as seeking employment and getting a job, doing the required tasks of the job, attending work on time as required, supervising other workers or being supervised, and performing required tasks alone or in groups.

content.title: d8700 Personal economic resources
content.description: Having command over personal or private economic resources, in order to ensure economical security for present and future needs.

content.title: d8701 Public economic entitlements
content.description: Having command over public economic resources, in order to ensure economical security for present and future needs.

content.title: b11421 Orientation to others
content.description: Mental functions that produce awareness of the identity of other individuals in one's immediate environment.

content.title: b16703 Reception of body language

content.title: b16718 Expression of language, other specified
b21000 Binocular acuity of distant vision
content.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour using both eyes for objects distant from the eye.

content.title: b21001 Monocular acuity of distant vision
content.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour using either right or left eye alone, for objects distant from the eye.

content.title: b21002 Binocular acuity of near vision
content.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour, using both eyes, for objects close to the eye.

content.title: b21003 Monocular acuity of near vision
content.description: Seeing functions of sensing size, form and contour, using either right or left eye alone, for objects close to the eye.

content.title: b21008 Visual acuity functions, other specified
b21020 Light sensitivity
content.description: Seeing functions of sensing a minimum amount of light (light minimum), and the minimum difference in intensity (light difference).
content.inclusions: Inclusions: functions of dark adaptation; impairments such as night blindness (hyposensitivity to light) and photophobia (hypersensitivity to light)

content.title: b21021 Colour vision
content.description: Seeing functions of differentiating and matching colours.

content.title: b21022 Contrast sensitivity
content.description: Seeing functions of separating figure from ground, involving the minimum amount of luminance required.

content.title: b21023 Visual picture quality
content.description: Seeing functions involving the quality of the picture.
content.inclusions: Inclusions: impairments such as in seeing stray lights; affected picture quality (floaters or webbing); picture distortion, and seeing stars or flashes

content.title: b21028 Quality of vision, other specified
